questions possible tw for last question, please be careful.. i would like to start this off by apologizing for the length of this post. i started actual recovery four days ago. this time, i'm actually committed. it's not half assed, and i'm trying very hard to break food rules. i am very, very scared though. based on the information i have and have not gathered, there are numerous questions i have. please, if you can, help me with these. just to reinforce the title, the last question can be a little triggering, or maybe not. i'm not sure, but if i were to see that at my lowest point i would be quite triggered myself. ease proceed with caution :. 1 extreme hunger or binge eating? i read online that in the beginning of recovery you experience something known as extreme hunger. it makes sense, but then i heard someone referring to it as recovery binging. i did some more research and i read that i could be developing bed, that's not my end goal and i don't know how to prevent it. i don't know what it is, but when will this period end? how long does it take, generally? i feel as if it won't ever stop, it scares me. i don't want to call this binging but the more i think about it, the worse it gets. 2 how long does weight redistribution take to occur? i love joking about this but right now i look like vector, it's all fun and games until i realize how stupid i probably look to others. i know i should wear baggy clothing but the feeling of uncomfortableness from within does not go away by simply wearing something big. how long did it take for you guys? i know everybody is different but i would like to find an average. 3 when the hell should i eat? i don't know when to eat, i've been following my mental hunger cues even if i ate less than an hour ago and i've been following my rare physical hunger cues, but i don't know when to eat. how distanced should my meals be, and should i wait until i feel physically hungry before i eat? 4 how much should i eat? i don't want to eat beyond satisfaction and i don't want to eat below satisfaction either but there is no set point to satisfaction and it's making me extremely anxious. i don't like eating so frequently but i don't know why i keep thinking about food, even if i'm full as hell. tw inpatient treatment 5 i have not been sent to inpatient treatment but i feel like i need it, should i ask for it or is it too late? as i mentioned earlier, i started recovery four days ago but i have not been sent to inpatient treatment. for the past four days i have been eating like shit, and each passing day becomes more and more mentally draining. after doing some research, i learned that the refeeding system is what is generally implemented with beginning stages of recovery. as of late, i have been feeling increasingly irritable due to the amount of food i have been consuming and i am scared of developing binge eating disorder. i understand that this is just extreme hunger but i don't know what to do i'm so sorry for the length of this post. thank you to anyone who replies. i wish you all the best of luck

smallest victories . so i've really hit restriction bad lately and i have gotten so used to the pain of hunger that i just ignore it most days because i don't even realize i'm in it. however, i had a wake up call a while back and decided to start small by drinking nutrient shakes drinking something feels way easier than eating anything . i'm a voice actor, and i drank a shake about 3 minutes before i went in the booth. i have not heard such strong acting come from me in a while and i realized after some mindfulness that wait... my entire body doesn't hurt? i don't have brain fog? i am in a good mood and having a great time? even just the smallest amount of intake changed the way i felt like night and day and it helped me realize that providing myself with the things i need to survive doesn't have to hurt and now i have solid proof that yes, i will feel better whenever i treat my body kindly. it felt like such an "aha" moment and i'm so thankful for it. i just had another shake this morning and am already feeling my body pains go away. any step toward progress is progress, period, and i'm really proud of myself for this. i am always inspired by the posts and support i see here and i'm thankful for this subreddit because it has helped me feel so much less alone. thank you all for reading and thank you for allowing me to be here lt;3 i wish you all many victories of your own, also.

i m really struggling in recovery now. is this an okay diet for a 15 year old boy? i'm scared i'm eating too much. i do intermittent fasting 5 days a week. i don't eat between 8 12. the reason behind this is to be able to identify when im hungry vs when i'm bored. i don't think it's affecting my mental health negatively. i used to think about food all the time but now it's only on my mind a few minutes before mealtime. i feel much better. amp; x2 b; anyways i've been having anxiety about my diet, and just need a little bit of validation. on the weekends only breakfast: 2 instant oatmeal plain packs banana peanut butter 1 2 tbsp coffee with soy milk amp; x2 b; lunch every day brown or white rice 1 1.5 cups lots of sauteed broccoli, cauliflower, tofu, and peas. or tempeh snack carrots and about 1 3 cup of hummus more coffee and soy milk i like a lot of milk in my coffee dinner same as lunch dessert i have every night since i fast in the morning about 1 1.5 cups of cereal with banana, peanut butter, and soy milk. on the weekends i have dark chocolate with this one small bar 16 cals i'm currently at a weight that i'm happy at: 5'4 1 1 5 lbs amp; x2 b; and i'm nervous i'm eating too much. i have too much soy milk and maybe too much rice. i also run four miles 4 5 times a week. i love running i'm just nervous. i just ate the cereal and dark chocolate and peanut butter and banana for dessert and i feel fine but it feels like it was too much. i m so scared.

finding self worth without an...is it even possible?. to start, i do not miss anorexia at all i do not miss feeling like a feeble animal because it s a torment to eat around people; i do not miss the mood swings and psychotic thoughts; i do not miss hiding in a bathroom to eat a cliff bar; i do not miss getting cold when it s 75 degrees out; i do not miss passing out after a jog; i do not miss buying children s clothes at 25 nor do i miss the confused faces people would give me when i d tell them i m an adult when my body looked like a sick child . i don t miss any of it. and i still hate what it did to my social life and how it made me lose 6 of my hair. but why is it, i m weight restored now, i m free and yet i still hate myself. i find no issue with my new body because i recognize it was inevitable and a matter of life early death but when 1 of all your thoughts,goals, and aspirations revolves around weight loss and calorie restriction, and your ed mind has finally silenced while you lost every speck of who you are in the process who the fuck am i now ? idk. i really don t know and though i hate my ed so much, why is it that i can t find anything interesting or enjoyable about myself anymore? ironically i cared way less about myself with my ed but felt so much more alive, real, and not as plain and depersonalized as i do now. i feel like anorexia erased me and i ll never come back . i want to feel renewed but i don t know how and fuck anyone who reads this and says you wont find yourself by posting on reddit; do something with your life . i m not looking for a self help. i m not looking for mantras . i want to know who has experienced this emptiness and sense of feeling lost and if it ever goes away or it s just the remnants of the disorder .

my anorexia recovery journey so far. hey guys i'm a 17 year old teenager with an ed that started may 2 21 that result me losing my period and went from me being slightly overweight for my bmi due to lack of mobility during covid to being almost to underweight for my bmi i am an athlete so i probably lost muscle and have a larger body structure which is probably why even at my lowest weight i never dipped into an "underweight" bmi anyways i "came out" to my parents one day about my eating disorder last december as i realize it was ruining my life. i had went from a slightly insecure happy teenage girl to a girl who would only think about food and be angry all the time. i was also cold all the time and when i went on a trip to las vegas where it was literally 11 degrees, i was cold. it sucked. my hair started falling out and i didn't feel like myself. in the end, i started scaring myself with the pictures i took off myself. i went to the doctor and she said i had lost a lot of weight and said thats why i had lost my period and she put me on hormones, which didn't even work. at this point i knew i destroyed my body and wanted to recover for myself. it was hard but i started to raise my calories slowly each week by 1 . i didn't notice a significant increase in weight and was just happy that i wasn't under a certain number. to put it in perspective, my lowest weight was the same when i was 12 years old. i have since then started recovery with equip health and it hasn't been easy. i be honest, i still count calories in secret , but have increased it to 2,35 . they have restricted my movement significantly which suxked because i weight lifted, walked around 1 to 2 miles daily and rollerskated every other day for maybe 2 to 3 hours making me moderately active. i've only been skating recently under supervision if i eat before and after which has been hard. the first days were especially hard, as they had me eat breakfast. i hadn't eaten breakfast for basically my entire life but taking it to the extreme during the height of ed doing intermittent fasting and not eating till sometimes 5pm. after the initials tantrums about not being in control of what i'm eating and when to eat, its been going great this is my second week and i already am feeling so much better i now have had breakfast everyday, poop everyday which is crazy because i've had constipation problems my entire life and just feel more energized and happy sometimes its hard to eat things that i don't feel are "worth it" or have enough protien, but i feel a lot freerer in general. i haven't been able to see my weight which doesn't bother me too much, it's just kinda of triggering when my parents hug me after weighing me because obviously i've gained weight lol, but the i dont really care and my body looks the same, if anything just a little more filled out but i have so much more energy i also have gotten over my fear of oil and its really weird because it only took about a week please keep in mind that this is my recovery journey and that everyone's is different and the quickness of my journey has been not only a shock to me, but my therapists. i've had some great motivators, like as soon as i get my period back, i can exercise more moderately lol and i'm very all or nothing so i put all the energy i focused on my ed into my recovery. i also feel that as i feel better about myself and in general l, its more of a motivator for me to get better. i'm just pretty proud of myself and i want to let everyone here know who is struggling that recovery is worth it and starting sooner is way better than never trying. another reason i think my review has been faster is because i was anorexic for less than a year. i know some people don't have that luxury, but just know that no matter where you are with your ed, its never to late to start recovery even if it is gradual. i hope this is motivating to you all out there and just know that weight shifts everyday and throughout life we are meant to grow and change. getting rid of weighing yourself and setting a calorie goal helped me get better but it might differ for you i just hope you all help yourself by treating yourself and making yourself a priority in recovery lt;3

blood sugar hypoglycemia issues?. hello, i am a 31 y o male who has been battling anorexia for about 4 years now. i've unintentionally lost a few pounds over the last 6 months after being at an all time high weight starting to feel better. i've been pushing myself too hard in the gym and a lot of movement at work. i have been eating a significant amount of calories this whole time. i am getting basic blood work done today unfortunately not my a1c or glucose just basic rbc,wbc etc . to see what is going on. i was diagnosed anemic 2.5 years ago deep into my e d. i've been battling what feels like hypoglycemia and severe anxiety the last 2 3 days. i had these symptoms a couple of weeks ago but it went away. i am getting hard body crashes about 1 2 hours after eating. extreme fatigue, irritability, dizziness confusion etc. i have noticed some sugar seems to bring me right back to momentarily. the other night i was not near food and went about an hour with these conditions. i immediately consumed a very large piece of dessert cake and felt like i was going to pass out. extreme chills, shaking, jitters which lasted about 2 3 minutes. this was my wake up call something really isn't right. i am scared and will do whatever it takes to fix these issues. no more gym. massive amounts of food. i am going to find another doctor on monday to test my a1c etc. has anyone had issues with their blood sugar? were you able to fix it during weight restoration recovery? i am 1 dedicated and scared, i believe the anxiety is also being brought on by this i am assuming. i can supply numbers weights calories if anyone is interested in pm.

how to deal with weight gain in recovery going to certain areas ?. what the title says basically, i don t know how to deal with the weight gain going specifically to my belly,thighs and face and not evenly distributing around my body. i want a flat stomach so i can feel good about my body and be more confident about it , but i don t know how to get that healthily in recovery

saying things out loud to make them real. i wanted to get honest. my insurance hasn't gotten back to me. i have been purposely missing my eda meetings and i feel like i am in a black hole. i am drowning in sadness. i feel so helpless over the ed. i have returned to making healthier choices but it's hit or miss. i have sadness and shame. i know this is just the stinky thinking of the ed. when i meditate on what's wrong it resounds that i am struggling with low self love. i see it and it makes me sad. so i use the ed and that creates new problems in my life. i am so tired of living like this.
going out to eat today . i'm scared shitless, going out to eat today for the first time in a very long time. but we'll survive, and i hope it'll be a tasty survival. wish me luck

hypertension with anorexia?. is it possible to have higher blood pressure with anorexia? i went to the doctor s today and had routine check up stuff done and i was blood pressure 132 69. i was told that is normal and it s only risky at 14 or higher. however i read that 13 or higher is sometimes considered per hypertension high normal and should be monitored. i was surprised since i assumed with anorexia it would be too low of blood pressure. granted, i am normal weight not underweight now but still recovering.

did anyone go on birth control in recovery?. i m 27 f whose never been on birth control because 1 years of an plus childhood trauma never allowed me to have a sex life. now that i m weight restored after about 9 months of recovery, i m wondering if it be a good idea to go on birth control just to regulate hormone production? not to say i have abnormalities now but since my breasts are still small, i m wondering if it s from a lack of estrogen? i still lack any libido too. i know there was a period in time that i had high androgen levels and though i haven t gotten any hormone tests since weight restoring, i m wondering how recovering people have experienced taking birth control.

do you ever feel underappreciated?. i m in recovery right now and it is hard af. especially at school. i m balancing all my work and my mental battle along with friends, and i just feel underappreciated by my friends. like do they not understand what i have to go through everyday on top of ed recovery? on top of like college stuff? my parents? and it s starting to affect my recovery because i just feel crap everyday :

a question for anyone else who didn t reach an extremely low weight. when you hear that you have to be severely underweight to qualify as anorexic, does it trigger you too? every time i hear this it makes me feel extremely invalid and want to start restricting again to do it right this time. i don t want to relapse, and i can t like i did before because i need to be able to function at work, but i hate essentially being told that i wasn t anorexic. the textbook that triggered me this time is basically saying my experience was only displaying symptoms of anorexia, this reminds me too much of how i justified it in the past by saying i had anorexic tendencies instead of admitting that i was anorexic. with my symptoms, the physical effects, and how little i was eating, how can it not be anorexia? i started at overweight and i started recovering before i was underweight because losing my period and my hair for as long as i was scared me, i had no energy to feel emotions anymore, and i was struggling to form sentences. it was affecting my personal relationships and i couldn t lose my support system because of something i was self inflicting. why does recovering when i did make me invalid in the eyes of other people? why do so many people reinforce the idea that i wasn t sick enough?

extreme hunger is ruling my life tw . genuinely listen to the tw if you're vulnerable firstly i want to apologise that all my posts are in a similar playing field but i still need to get this off of my chest i've had extreme hunger for a few weeks now and it's gotten way out of proportion. today its holidays where i live the largest break i've had was around an hour or two to go food shopping, otherwise i have spent all day either cooking, washing my dishes so i could use them for food again or eating. i feel intense shame. i go into the kitchen as litte as possible because i dont want anyone to see and judge me. honestly if i felt capable of stopping myself i'd go right back to restriction out of pure panic, which is also so so dumb because i have goals which i can't reach by depriving myself, even now i'm consistently falling back to safe foods and eating lower calorie options even though i know it could sabotage the process. yesterday i didn't eat for too long and i got so hungry that i detached from reality and the people around me. i cannot feel physically or mentally satisfied no matter how much i consume. i cannot concentrate on school anymore because all i think about is food and i don't want to meet any of the people i love because then i won't be able to eat if i'm away from home. i'm considering asking my doctor to do a leptin resistance test but i also think im just hoping i have it so i don't feel as guilty. the guilt is mind numbing i swear. by this point i think this can't be classified as extreme hunger anymore. what are your thoughts? and do you have any tips on dealing with this? have a lovely day

tired of fighting relapse. does anyone else just getting exhausted trying to keep up with recovery? i went to treatment 4 years ago and i still feel like i ve made no progress, even tho i m in a bigger body now. sometimes i feel like i don t even want recovery and i don t know what to do about that.

body dysmorphia after birthday weekend. it was my 21st on saturday, and the past three days i ve been eating bad food. i had a vegan burger on the friday, pizza hut with my family and bf on saturday and vegan bk on sunday. i know i shouldn t be ashamed but i feel awful for letting myself eat so bad. i had two vegan chicken wraps today and even that i feel is way too much. i can t stop looking up celebrity measurements and comparing myself to literal rich highly trained people. i m so insecure about my bone structure and it stresses me out that i m stuck with it. aaaaa

tangible goals. basically last summmer when i like went through my first round attempt of anorexia recovery and was able to get my weight up not restored but enough to allow me to play soccer a big reason was because i had a tangible goal that i needed to hit a set weight to play soccer. this time i don t have that goal because i m done with college soccer so i didn t know if anyone has any ideas or anything to kind of mimic that? p.s i know i wasn t truly recovered this summer as i was never weight restored and was not mentally recovered.

health problems that persisted after weight restoration?. i m curious to know if anyone on here faced long term complications even after they were weight restored ? i ve been weight restored for about 2 months now and my doctor confirmed it just this tuesday and i was ecstatic however, something i ve been realizing so far is a lot of stuff isn t what all the ed recovery blogs made it out to be. after 9 months of recovery, my hair continues to have the slowest growth imaginable and is still dealing with crazy breakage. i thought my bald spots would heal up and though there s new growth there now, it s terribly slow. my skin is a hell of a lot less dull and pale and i don t have dark circles under my eyes anymore, but my skin is now more prone to rosacea and acne . my lanugo went away but there s still hair on my nipples. i don t have mood swings anymore nor deal with psychotic and or ed thoughts but i still have no libido. i don t get joint pain anymore, but also think my bones are still pretty weak. surely there are far more severe heath complications post ed than this and i still haven t went to an endocrinologist or rheumatologist to check on my thyroid and joints but sometimes i get scared thinking what the future will hold with 1 years of anorexia. i m hoping for body resilience but i don t fully see it yet . though all my labs are coming out within normal range now, still somehow i wish i could see more progress especially with my hair . ultimate poor body image trigger rn.
mood swings. does anyone else experience experienced extreme mood swings during recovery?

recovery and appetite. i have been in recover for about 2 months. i went through extreme hunger and ive been honoring my hunger queues. i do not struggle at all with anorexic thoughts anymore. however, it has become extreme hard to eat. i still try my hardest. if i cant eat i use ensure and other shakes. i loose my appetite soooo easily. i don't know why this is happening. i feel like i should still have extreme hunger or just back to normal. i did not go see a doctor about my eating disorder besides my pychiatrist. is this normal? im going to make a doctors appointment tomarrow. its just soo frustrating

i was underweight for 1 years and i really wonder what damage i did.. most of this time i d say i was mildly underweight bmi around 17 17.5 . other times i was at bmi 15. i grew up in a house with no food. mom was chronically ill and dad didn t give half a shit. that led to me scavenging and begging for food from an early age. by 7 i was always packing my own lunch, which was a scant mix of foods that weren t real foods, like a granola bar. i went to a tiny school and i think the teachers knew my parents were nowhere near poor, but they saw me constantly beg. i believe they said nothing because, how could i not have food? we weren t poor. my brother and i thought a delicacy was microwaving cheese in a bowl. my mom has had anorexia since age 17. she is now 55. she s damaged her metabolism to the point where she s at a normal weight and probably eats under 8 cal a day. i went through childhood seeing my very thin mother bawling her eyes out because she gained five pounds, and just not eating. i m pretty sure her diet these days consists of small mugs of ice cream and a few almonds. meals were not cooked. food was not available. the pantries and fridge had maybe milk and pretzels. i was responsible for 95 of my meals. i remember being 14 and in health class. my friends mom cooked us a pot of corned beef with veggies with a pressure cooker. i stuffed myself and was utterly shocked that other people got that. i told my mom not at all meaning to be spiteful that i had a good home cooked meal for the first time in months and was so excited. she cried. nothing changed. from about age 12 well, probably before to 22 23, i was at most bmi 17.5 and at least, 15. i got my period at age 12, at 4 9 and no more than 8 lbs, more like 75. i was bmi 15 for maybe two and a half years. i have been in recovery for another 2.5 years. i m a normal weight for the first time since practically toddlerhood. and i have chronic health issues. i wonder constantly how much was malnutrition and anorexia. i know some issues run in the family, but i feel like i got a shit start and i may be damaged for it. thanks for letting me rant.

i need help. trigger warning i can't eat. and i hate myself for it. cause i know that i have to get better. but i am all alone for one whole weekend and i can't eat by myself. i don't know who to ask help to. i am so hungry tho. i don't know what to do :

got my period back after 13 months :v . i really thought that it wouldn't happen. my health has been so bad because of my restricting, and even though i never technically went underweight for my bmi although i was close , i had lost so much weight in such a short period of time that it did numbers on my body. i had spotted a few months ago but that was it. today, there was a clot and everything sorry for the tmi lol . i totally cried. i was literally on the verge of a hardcore relapse too. now i might actually be able to be a mom one day. please keep your heads up, i thought i was a lost cause for so long. your body knows how to heal, you just have to nourish it

starting a book. i ve started writing a book about my ana journey. where it started and i m thinking it ll end with my first rehab stint. and if i m able to get it published i ll make it into a series. the rest will document my relapses and recoveries until now. i m 18 months in recovery. but my journey has lasted 21 years. i have the prologue and very beginning. would anyway want to read that and tell me if i m on the right path to starting an interesting book? it would be so helpful to me.

i recognised a pattern. hi, i'm really sorry for posting so much lately but this community makes me feel so valid and understood recently i recognised a pattern. tomorrow is day 15 of recovery and so far i'm challenging myself by introducing "new old food" i liked but didn't eat in the past two years. last week for example i bought butter and milk because i loved bread with butter and salt with a glas of milk as a child, the other day it was cheese, today hummus. so whenever i buy something like this i go crazy. like i eat so so much of it. and then the next day i have some more but not too much, instead a normal amount. not because of restriction though, but because that's all i crave. i feel like my body's first instinct is to eat a lot of this new food because it is scared that that will be the last time it can have it, but then it realises that that's not true and i can enjoy it whenever. the first day of recovery i literally ate 4 pieces of cake or something obviously way more, i'm looking at you chocolate and i wanted more all the time, but now i'm satisfied with one piece of cake every couple of days. also, the first couple times i ate until i was stuffed. that doesn't happen anymore either. however this satisfaction only works with foods i reintroduced. new foods are still devoured as if i'm a wild animal lol. did anyone else experience this?

i'm tired of being hungry.. i feel like i'm hungry all the time even though i've gained some weight. because i'm not as dangerously underweight as i was, i feel like i shouldn't be this hungry anymore, so i need to resist and restrict. i'm having a hard time trusting my body and believing that i won't just keep eating and gaining indefinitely. i can't sleep and i'll be up at all hours feeling ravenous. it's really tough because i don't feel thin anymore. when i look at myself i don't look thin to myself either, despite others telling me i'm still underweight and need to keep eating and gaining. i want to lose what i've gained and go back to where i was. i keep thinking that i was almost to my goal. logically, this makes no sense, but it's hard to not give in and start restricting again.

anyone experience zero extreme hunger?. hello, i see so many posts about extreme hunger but i ve been in recovery for a little over 5 months now, and gained weight and have good lab work, and feel better than i have in years. i was anorexic for 15 years. i was expecting to be hit with the extreme hunger many people talk about, but i haven t had it at all. during the phase you would expect extreme hunger, i did have extreme cognitive symptoms dramatic mood swings, severe fatigue, irritability that got worse before they got better. during this time i had no appetite and was still fighting through every meal and snack. my dietician posited that this might be my version of extreme hunger. i was just curious if anyone else had this experience, or maybe had the extreme hunger much later in recovery? my hunger cues are slowly but surely being restored, and it did occur to me that maybe i was experiencing extreme hunger but i just did not recognize what i felt as hunger. anyway, mostly just curious

how do i make myself eat?. i don t really know how to word this, but i ve been in recovery for about a year after struggling with anorexia for five years. i have an appetite, but i can t bring myself to eat, even though i want to gain weight and rebuild my relationship with food. does anyone have any advice as to how to fix this?

feel sicker through recovery. i didn t used to be like how i am now. food and walking has become all of my life, since i started getting help from doctors, psychologists and nutritionist. my life was so different. i hate how i was labeled anorexic because of my sister. i used to live, now i am daily calculating and am uber focused on food. fuck

i don't feel sick enough to deserve recovery. does anyone else keep feeling like they should have gotten worse before they got better? i keep wishing that i stayed sick longer, i only had my eating disorder for about 8 months before i began recovery though my issues with food started four years ago. it's stupid because if i had put off recovery any longer my heart would have stopped. i medically could not have survived being sick longer, yet i keep feeling like this means i'm not sick enough. anyone else have a similar experience?

tw relapse ment. what counts as a relapse ?. trigger warning mention of skipping meals etc i m a little curious of what counts as an ed relapse rather than just a minor slip up this week i asked my treatment team if i could start eating my lunch at school again i d been coming home and eating it supervised so far in recovery and they said if i trusted myself i could try and see how it goes. and lo and behold, almost habitually or automatically i skipped lunch every day. i ve also been exercising more again which seems to have come hand in hand with it. but i have still eaten breakfast, dinner and a snack because those are still supervised.. so is this still a relapse?? especially as i ll probably have to get back on track next week as i m assuming they ll be able to tell by the scale that somethings gone wrong

how to cope with getting rid of scale?. i am trying to recover since a week and a half ago. it s not been going great. i ve had a couple binges where i ve just let myself eat and it was traumatic. so i ve basically restricted a lot and decided my recovery can t include extreme eating binging. still sticking mostly to safe food but have had a few wins. i weighed myself on tuesday and i had lost a tiny bit. i was upset and relieved at the same time. i am severely underweight and having so many physical issues lately. i want to get better for my husband and daughter. i used to be a runner. now i m just a ghost. my husband has been almost distraught the last week seeing me go up and down and be all over the place emotionally. anyway we got rid of the scale tuesday. it s driving me batshit that i don t know my weight. yes, i am still terrified of gaining weight. i was supposed to have an appointment tomorrow that got canceled and i m devastated because now i won t find out my weight. on one hand, it s good because i won t see if i ve gained. on the other, it makes me worry that i am out of my ed safe zone . tldr: any tips advice for coping with the loss of access to a scale? my life has sadly revolved around it for so long i feel lost without it and it s seriously stalling recovery.

struggling. i just feel like the extreme hunger will never stop. i've been going through it for over 12 months now and it's gotten worse. yesterday i was feeling really hopeful because it was the second day i was feeling less hungry . i already got my hopes up that i was done with it but today... horrible again. i've gained so much weight and am approaching an overweight bmi. sometimes i'm not even sure if it is actual hunger because my stomach also feels inflamed. i'm so bloated all the time, i actually look pregnant. i already feel like a beached whale and there is no end in sight

supporting a recovering friend. cw: reference to self body image, weight hello. firstly, i think it s amazing that there is a space here on reddit for recovering people to find support. i wanted to find somewhere where i may be able to understand more about how i can support a recovering friend. they have been struggling with anorexia for many years now, but they are getting treatment. it is tough, as they are in hospital a lot, but we message and call a lot and i m just trying to make sure i m there for them. recently they ve started talking more about their body, and i m not sure how i can approach conversations about it. as i have never experienced anorexia, i m really nervous when they make comments on their medication making them gain weight etc. they have been making these comments about their body more frequently as of late. i don t want to shut down what they re saying, but i also don t know how to reassure them in this situation. i feel like being told they re beautiful etc is something they probably hear a lot, and as anorexia is more than just a physical illness i m not sure whether it helps to tell them things like this. i was wondering whether anyone might be able to offer some insight in to how i could best help support them? no matter what i will be there for them, but i want to understand more about how i can support them

rosacea in recovery. anyone else develop this once they were weight restored and or at a healthier weight ? it s not chronic luckily but at least once twice a week i develop red bumps on my cheeks that start fading away in like 2 3 days. i wonder if it s a result of using rogaine and accidentally having exposure to it on my face or if it s just a recovery thing.

freaking out over a tiny increase in my meal plan. i just got out of hospital yesterday and today did not go well so i had to make some changes. it ended up being a miniscule increase not even triple digits but i need some reassurance that the world won't end when i implement them tomorrow because i'm honestly struggling so hard but if i don't make these changes there will have to be more but i can't think about that right now then i'll just end up back in hospital and i can't deal with that

how to get rehabilitate, rewire,recover. i know it is a weird question since amazon is obvious but i live in egypt so the shipping is gonna be too expensive and i don't have any idea how else to get it

am i actually hungry or not?. today, i've been eating a lot however, i don't know if it's because i'm bored or actually hungry. on top of that, i'm so scared i'll become too heavy, i'm having urges to relapse i'm so scared

medication. hey so i m currently on lexapro for depression and anxiety but my therapist wants to add in mirtazapine and claims it will help stimulate appetite. anyone ever been on it? thoughts on adding it in? thanks

scared i'll eat a lot forever. hello again. so since starting recovery, i've been honouring my hunger cues and thus obviously eating more. now some days, my meal plan is enough. other days i'm just so so hungry and eat more and that's when my anorexic mind tells me things like "see, this is why you shouldn't eat. you have no control over yourself, you're greedy and you'll never stop eating this much." can someone please just reassure me that once my body trusts my intake and is not malnourished anymore, this will balance out?

i m too broken over what anorexia did to my hair. am i always going to look this ugly?. when i was at my lowest weight, something crazy happened while i was in remission from alopecia. my hair was growing the fastest it ever grew before. i had a literal lion s mane of hair and unfortunately, my sick self was convinced my ed was healthy as my hair continuously bursted in every strand from a previous patch. now what i didn t know at this time was how short lived that growth spurt would be. hormonal imbalances in androgen levels contributed to the fast growth but then within 5 months, it contributed to the fastest loss ever. about 8 inches of my hair fell off ; i developed 2 new bald patches at my crown and guess when all this happened? 2 17. 5 years and you d think my hair would ve grown tremendously by now right? no. my patches are still visible and the extent to which all my hairs uneven in length makes me hate myself for what i did even more. thyroid damage stunted any possible growth. and i ve been in recovery 9 months and i m finally at a healthy fucking weight and im seeing breakage even now the new hairs are even growing in matted and just so fucked to where i think i might ve permanently damaged follicles? i m getting treatment from my dermatologist; i apply rogaine everyday plus topical ointments but my god, how much fucking longer do i have to hate myself like this? i can t even get hair extensions because my dermatologist said the extra weight and pressure to the scalp will lead to even more fall out. if i can go back in time and never have become anorexic, i d give the fucking world for it. why is it once i m healthy , i have to suffer from what anorexia s done? why is it when i ve overcame 1 years of starving myself, i have to still see the effects of anorexia on my head every day. fuck my life.

....i might not have had an ed?. ok so idk how to start but yesterday i deleted mfp and stopped calorie counting , yes it was really hard to to and anxiety was through the roof same for today but...i somehow feel way more free and i haven't been restricting today and even thought about buying chocolate which i never ate and even made lunch without measuring stuff and didn't freak out as much as i thought i would , does that mean that i've been faking this entire time? what if i was doing it for attention and liked the title? idk , it seems way too easy rn that i'm starting to get scared like...i'm starting to crave some of my fear foods which makes no sense to me since the thought of eating them gives me so much anxiety , idk

i deleted mfp. so today i finally got fed up and tired of, i guess it is called quasi recovery?, but yeah ,at the start of my recovery i told myself i would increase calories and track them every week to make sure i was eating enough but i realized today how i've made no progress in three months so i deleted it and decided to honor hy body hunger cues but the problem is that i have been eating all day, im scared because what if i just trade anorexia for binge eating? also, i have no idea what are actual hunger cues so someone told me that thinking about food is considered one of them but i'll be thinking of food like 2 monuites after having a meal and feel really bloated , i really don't know what to do

some days hungrier than others?. so i have a really stupid question. this is week two of recovery and i decided to do it by sticking to a meal plan after some initial binges which i believe were a direct reaction to the recent restriction before committing to recovery . so i eat three meals and three snacks, also hitting the recommended calories. some days i'm not hungry at all but still make myself eat all my meals and snacks, other days i get hungry just in time for every meal and snack and other days i'm hungry more often. that happened like twice a couple of days back. i don't think that it's extreme hunger since i can feel full after having a couple more snacks or going back for seconds or something. but i'm wondering, is that normal? like is it normal to be more hungry on some days and less hungry on other days even though i'm not "moving" more or doing more intense things than on the days i'm less hungry? i'm honestly confused because i ignored my hunger cues for like two years and i don't really remember what it was like before. thanks

is anyone else just not hungry after having their period?. i get that way right after my period ends or towards the end of my period, i just don t feel hungry. anyone else get that way also? i am thinking it s hormonal since it s always like that but it doesn t help with recovery since i only get that way then and the rest of the time i am good about eating during recovery with very little issues. occasionally an issue where i backtrack for a split second but the period thing feels different like i just can t work up an appetite. if this happens to you, what do you do in this situation? tia

will i ever have a sex drive again?. this is something that s really starting to bother me. with 9 months into recovery and very much ed free, i ve yet to feel sexually desirable . i think about it quite often , occasionally feel horny but still i find it almost impossible to do it with my husband. the thought and the act are separate. and ironically, i don t hate or feel any disgust in my new body i actually prefer it. but with years of being underweight, i convinced myself my husband wasn t attracted to me because i looked like a 12 year old throughout almost all my twenties and just thought without an ass and tits, it was pointless to have sex . for years i didn t understand what he saw in me because i was so sick and eventually realized it . idk why but that s just how my mind operated . now the whole lack of a sex drive is giving me hardcore abandonment anxiety because i don t understand how my husband s handling it . he says it doesn t matter to him but still idk what to think. even though i m much more curvier now, idk ...somehow i don t really feel like i m inside this new body either . maybe the fact i m still recovering from anorexic hair loss contributes to the low self image ...idk really. i have depression too and sense without anorexia, i ve felt a bit more empty without my only coping mechanism but still this is starting to frustrate me.

anorexia into binge eating story . guys... i don't feel like this is right. i have anorexia for quite some time now and complaced into the disease without trying to change anything. when my period would be missing for months and people started noticing i'm on the verge of trading an organ for one more day of living on body fat, they started telling me that if i don't change and fix it, they will take me to a psychiatrist at the end of the respective month. scared of consequences and knowing that an actual psychiatrist would possibly bring me a lot of good against any psychosomatic disease i would encounter, i tried fixing myself. so the binges started. my boyfriend would tell me how i desperately need the calories, the carbs, we spoke about "cheats" being what i afford to eat right now because i need to gain weight. i am terrified ,i spent my entire week every 2 3 days binging to the point where i am physically hurt. i can barely breathe and cannot move and i feel like what i'm doing to myself is absolutely disgusting. the next days looking in the mirror feels like gaining a ton and i'm very unhappy and crying about how i currently look while gaining weight.. i know i have to fight through but is this really worth the pain im taking my body to? i'm really scared and suffering and if i open up to my boyfriend again he would be saying the same comforting me through "you need to eat you need it" ... the binge episodes i never asked for this and i don't know how to stop myself without falling into episodes of not eating ,anorexia again. i have learned so much about nutrition these months and been healthy gymming for a while but i feel like this is all useless. the eating disorders are still there and won't give me any breaks or my brain for a fact to the point where i don't understand what's healthy and what's not.

question about chest pain in recovery. does anyone else get a straining feeling on your upper left middle of your chest that radiates to the side of your neck when you are hungry? and then after you eat it goes away? has anyone figured out what that is because my advisor told me its heart burn or acid reflux but it doesnt feel like a burning sensation.

where to start. 2 2 i my mental health spiraled out of control. do to my severe depression i lost 1 ish pounds i was 12 ish now i m 2 8 i ve bounced back and forth between being 1 2 up to 1 8. and my loss of appetite has stuck with me. and now in my twisted head i have very many different thoughts about my eating, my body, recovering not recovering. i bounce back and forth on be motivated to do anything about it. and after cut off my nutritionist i of course got worse not in my weight but my thought around eating. is still don t know what i m going to do about this. but i was wondering if anyone has easy steps to eat more. and not get high and binge my entire pantry

question about getting period back. hi guys, i have been in some kind of recovery for a few months. i lost my period roughly 15 months ago. i wasn't extremely underweight at the time but was on the brink. i would really appreciate if anyone could tell me, do i get my period back by gaining a certain amount of weight or eating a certain amount of calories for a certain amount of time? i've always been told it would come back after i gain weight and eat enough, but this is too vague. what is the actual cause of it coming back? like why did i even lose it in the first place? did i stop eating enough calories or did i lose a bit too much weight? i would just like to know, out of interest, could i get my period back whilst still being underweight? this isnt my goal, dont worry, but i'm just curious . i'd really appreciate anyone's help. please dont be vague, i know eating well and gaining weight will make it come back but which one is the direct cause? thanks.

do i have a problem?. hello all you wonderful people. trigger warning for those who are fragile at the moment. i would just like some input. i was big, and i went down in size rather quickly for a year, and these problems started to arise. i started vomiting profusely, and felt nauseous every time after my meals i ate eat every single day, this is also why i m doubtful i actually have a disorder , and it kept getting worse and worse. i haven t heard anyone else linking their stories to mine, and idk if it s something else or just maybe an anxiety towards food. i am doing better rn with the nausea and vomiting, stay strong everyone and i wish you all good health

does anyone elses body feel heavy if they dont get enough fuel?. if i dont get enough food that day the next day it feels like a weight is pulling my body to the ground and it becomes hard to breathe..

i m trying so hard. i m trying my hardest and doing so well but i see the weight going up on the scale and i can now visibly see myself gaining the weight that is needed, i understand that. but it s scary and i feel as tho i m going to relapse

i feel so broken. ever since i tried to recover from anorexia i have been thinking about relapsing with my eating disorder, hurting myself, or trying to commit suicide. my disordered eating always gave me a sense of comfort and i rarely felt these emotions, but now they are very much present. i hate how i have to harm myself just to feel comforted. i honestly miss the sense of comfort my disordered eating gave me. i do but don't want to relapse because of it was the only way i felt comfort. god, i wish i was normal. i want to be free and not worry about weight gain. when can i be normal

16 year old male. orthorexia anorexia. what if i don t really feel hungry during recovery. am i supposed to still eat?. i am 16 male and i play baseball. i work with my high schools dietician to get on track better but i stopped seeing her for a bit. basically i have struggled for a long time with restricting my eats. i feel a lot of anxiety when i eat meals. i also lost a lot of weight and had dizzy spells a few months ago. i have been trying to refresh with the dietician but it is hard. i haven t been completely truthful with her about how little i eat someday. i currently can really only manage 3 small meals a day. snacks are a little too scary. that being said when it is a meal time i am never hungry. should i still eat despite this? my parents aren t really involved in my care because i have an autistic brother who needs lots of help. i am also maybe going to a boarding school next year so i really need to get my crap together. any help would be really good

question for recovered people.... i beat this about thirteen years ago. but still to this day i have trouble eating. i don't get hungry until about 4 or 5pm and if i try to eat before then it makes me feel like i need to puke. does anyone have any tips to get back to normal three meal eating? thanks all.

harry nipples at a healthy weight indicates what exactly?. i don t get it. not a single abnormal blood test result in 8 months. the hair on my scalp is growing back at a normal rate. the lanugo i used to have on my arms and legs have completely disappeared. my skin is clear and no longer gets dry every second nor do i always feel cold anymore. the last time i had high levels of testerone was the end of 2 2 . why is this still a problem? could it possibly be non ed related? i tried to talk about it with my dermatologist but she kinda shrugged it off with a hormones change overtime thing. i hate this shit.

working out ?. before anorexia i had a healthy relationship with exercise. i did it to feel better and to be a bit healthier. i often went to the gym with my friends, we weren t very serious but it was still fun. then i got anorexia and i started over exercising. when i started to recover i stoped all kind of exercise. my doctor advised me this. i am doing very good in recovery and i recently got my period back very happy i was thinking about going to the gym again. i miss working out tbh. i m not very scared that i ll over exercise and relapse. the thing i m scared for is losing my period again . any advice?

feeling out of control. hi. so i ve been recovering for a while and i still have some extreme hunger. i just start eating and it s hard to stop sometimes. i miss feeling in control and able to tell myself to not eat and actually doing so. now, it feels like even if i tried to restrict i literally can t. i know that it s normal to eat more and i should but it s really hard to cope with. especially when everyone around you eats less. i m also tormented by thoughts of the nutrition healthiness of foods. if anyone has any words of advice or would like to message me i d love it :

if sick with covid may need to eat more. so i have had covid and had it for a week and a half and have had a lingering cough 2 weeks after that and even now. it is brutal i feel pretty tired at times too. i am better though. what i learned from this experience and what i share with you is that i noticed something. i noticed when i eat more on in addition to what i have been eating in recovery i feel better and my cough goes away. but i have to eat a lot more food theni normally do to fight the fatigue and the cough. so i began researching. apparently after some searches i find that covid demands a big response from the immune system which requires a lot of calories. more calories than normally what we eat.

am i allowed to eat?. it sounds stupid i know but you all really helped me last time with your kind words. tysm for that. all i need is for somebody to tell me its okay to eat right now. even if i've already eaten enough today. i'm not a bad person, right? i'm not weak. restriction isn't an option. please somebody say its okay thats all i need. thanks :

my tummy really hurts after dinner. i don t know what to do and it is triggering. i had pizza for dinner with veggies. whenever i eat my stomach is in a lot of pain. i m sitting in my room crying because it hurts a lot. does anyone have tips on stomach pain in recovery?

help. help i don't mind sharing some personal info about it publicly but i'd rather talk in a chat about it, i am looking for actual help with my mentality, i feel like i'm slowly losing who i am, or was.

hunger, please help. i m never hungry i don t have hunger queues and nothing ever sounds good it s so frustrating. i don t know what to do

more energized than i should be?. so i feel like i should be more tired than i am if that makes sense did you experience that? i m lifting 5 days a week and doing about 8 1 k steps a day yet not eating a lot so i m kinda wondering i guess if from not feeding myself i m not allowing myself to be tired and recovery? it s just weird because i m at such a low weight i don t understand why

has anyone else experienced hearing loss?. for background i m in my late teens and i ve recovered like 85 from my 7 year long battle with anorexia. i ve noticed a massive decline in my eyesight due to me ed, but i ve also been noticing a concerning decline in my hearing. like i said, i m in my late teens so it s not age related. i was just wondering if anyone else has experienced this, or if it s not ed related.

tw mention of macros. ive had 226g of carbs and 3 mg of sodium today. im losing my fucking mind. this is way too much im going to blow up i want to scream. i have lunch with a friend tomorrow but i think im going to cancel i feel so ashamed.

overshoot. so i freaked out a couple of days of ago because i realized my weight is overshooting. i've since done some research on it and managed to calm myself down a little. but i was wondering if anyone here has experienced this? hearing other people's stories or advice would really help.

what do people eat for lunch???. i feel like i'm losing it over this lmao i've been reflecting a lot recently, and i've realized that while i try to go all in on the weekends, i end up restricting during the weekdays. i'm a teacher, and i can't eat lunch when my kids do, so i'm usually waiting until 1 or 2 to eat. which, i admit, is still normal lunch time but it feels wild to me haha i don't pack my lunch, and i think that's my biggest issue here. i'm setting myself up for failure 1 here, but... i don't even know what i'd put in a lunch box? i was in a state of semi recovery before this relapse and so i was only eating specific foods when i was student teaching. i packed the same meal every single day. i'm wondering now if i should go back to that? even if it's the same thing every day, it's at least consistent. i don't really know what i'm asking here, haha. what do y'all eat for lunch? :p

leaving food, fitness and calorie counting subreddits. i love food, cooking is a passion of mine but i just can't stop comparing other people to myself. i was talking to an acquaintance of mine about how i used to be on the swim team. "you used to be really into calorie counting, you had an app for it and everything" is that how you remember me? i thought i was so much more than that i tried really hard on the swim team and that's what you remember me for? it makes me sad, i just can't do this anymore. i want to be healthy, i want to be able to run if i had to, i want to walk up a flight of stairs and have it be no big deal. i want my fitness pal to stop sending me notifications and emails reminding me to step on the scale ffs until i get stronger i have to let go of these things until i know i can be responsible with them.

do i have to avoid mirrors forever now?. hi guys, so i recently started my recovery because i honestly grew so tired of anorexia. i'm super scared but with my hair falling out, being out of breath from just walking up a hill, being cold, brain fog .. you get it, i just can't live like this anymore. i'm recovering alone without a therapist and am eating more which eventually will result in gaining weight. i'm sure i've already gained but i threw out my scale and i avoided body checking by covering up my mirrors because i just can't see myself gain weight without relapsing. so i wanted to ask, did any of you recover and were able to look in the mirror again? i definitely do not plan to ever weigh myself again, i'm over that. been there, done that more than enough but i guess i would like to be able to see myself again in the future and not avoid any reflective surface. thanks

using only meal replacements because i m afraid of portioning my own food, is this ok?. hello, so i m an 18 year old male anorexic and it s been awful of course. recently i reached out for professional help but considering it s going to take a little while before i truly get to speak to a dietitian of some kind due to the lengthy queue for mental health in my country, i m looking for ways to recover on my own in the meantime. only problem is that my appetite is very high. i can only think about food and it causes me to eat until i m full on a good day. it makes me feel awful afterwards even though i m not binging on junk food. it hurts me when i have to stop eating. i also have a lot of anxiety around how much i eat so i cut down on portions to make sure my counted calories aren t underestimates. recently i discovered yfood and it s 5 calories a bottle with a decent combination of macro micros. i drink these 3 times per day and i feel fairly satiated but still some hunger pangs, i also crave solid food a lot . can i live off of these in the meantime? i m too afraid of normal food to trust myself to eat on my own anymore. these bottles seem reliable enough for me to offer a short term solution.

i m so insecure about my arms now?. trigger warning because body dysmorphia being in recovery is great, but i m so insecure about my arms. they re still thin but because i don t have muscle definition, whenever they re against my body, they flare out and it makes me feel so sick. i hate having soft muscle, it triggers me so much.

recovering alone trigger warning? . so i have struggled previously with bulimia heavily in 2 19 2 21. i overcame that but only with anorexia. i am completely fed up with it all. the constant lethargy, l xative abuse, stomach pains; i m sure a lot of you know these feelings too well. but i am desperate to get out of this circle, however i am 17 and i have a very busy life with school and my parents do not live close. i don t want to burden them at all. but i want to get out of this, and hopefully without additional help. any people here who ve recovered from disordered eating alone, with no one else s help have absolutely any tips on recovery for me. even if you think it won t align with my situation so much, please i am begging for it

i fully recovered from anorexia after 7 years. ask me anything . i've been what i would consider completely recovered for over 4 years now. i developed my ed aged around 14 and only started to properly recover aged 21. i'm now 25 and thriving in ways i could have never imagined at points in my illness, doctors called me a "lost cause" and stopped seeing recovery as a long term goal for me. ask me anything would love to help people in any way i can, and provide some hope if you need it. :

the same morning i agreed to go home and work on recovery is the same morning i hit a new lw and now i dont want to. last night after having a very intense breakdown, i phoned my nan. she told me my options were either go inpatient again or go home to her and follow a similiar inpatient program except i get to prepare and choose my own food. i was excited. i was going to get better. until i weighed myself this morning and woke up the smallest ive ever been. now i want to keep it, i dont want her to help me get better. im so triggered i just want to be small but i dont want to live like this either. maybe i could maintain? but its too late. shes coming today and theres no way she'll let me back out without taking me to hospital and fuck i messed up.

it feels like my family s trying to prevent me from recovering. i have a crap relationship w food and i have to mentally prepare myself for every meal. ive actually planned it out so for this full week i could eat dinner. and a few of them including tonights meant i could eat before my family did so i wouldn t have to eat in front of them but i went downstairs to start cooking and then found out that my mum changed the dinner for tonight meaninh id have to eat something im not prepared for with my family. i had literally the safest foods together cause im sick to death of being scared and ashamed to do something that literally every person has todo. ik its not on purpose but ive got a body food shaming brother, and a mum who refuses to acknowledge how much things like this hurt me. everytime we talk about food i end up crying, and as much as i wanna get better i cant with my family

debilitating hunger. so i thought i was done with recovery because i had gained all the weight back and was feeling fine for a while. but i've been having stomach issues constantly ranging from food sitting in my stomach and not moving to now it feels like it's not staying in there long enough. i've started gaining weight again and literally cannot get full. my stomach feels irritated and even painful at times and the hunger is constant. i was thinking that maybe it could be gastritis and took antacids yesterday which helped. but today they aren't helping and i feel even worse. i am literally so done with recovery, i just want it to be over. i feel like i can't take it anymore, it feels like absolute hell. i'm starting to think that maybe my body is never going to work normally again. i'm supposed to go on a trip in a few weeks with family members and if this keeps going i'm propably gonna end up spending the entire time in a hotel room binging. i feel like i just want to go to sleep and not wake up anymore.

chewing and spitting "binges". i've struggled with chewing and spitting food every day for the last 3 or so years. i do it religiously at 5pm and at 9pm. it's like a binge except i don't swallow the food. i know i'm still absorbing calories, so to make up for this i don't eat outside these chew and spit times. i haven't actively swallowed food in a really long time. there is nothing i want more than to stop this, but it's such a ritual at this point that i spiral if i can't do it. even when i was inpatient i found food to hoard and use for c s when i was really desperate. i couldn't tell nurses doctors because it's just to gross and embarrassing. it keeps my head quiet for a couple of hours a day and it's the only thing that's comforting. it's disgusting, embarrassing, expensive, bad for my teeth and it causes me to gain weight anyway. i've tried gradually cutting down the amount of food i go through in c s; i've tried replacing it with other coping mechanisms healthy and unhealthy ones ; and i've tried distracting myself. nothing has worked. i do it even if i don't want to and i continue even when i'm not enjoying it. it's so hard to find info about this online, or to find other people who have experienced it. i'm sure there's someone out there who can relate? i would appreciate any contribution to this advice, personal experience with recovering, a comment saying that you struggle with the same literally anything

i feel like the only way to get rid of my anorexia is to let it kill me. i've been inpatient twice and both times i came out, i instantly invested all my energy into getting rid of the weight gain. ive been forced to recover, ive tried to recover on my own, ive tried it all. but it just doesnt work. the compulsions wont go away. the obsession wont go away. im trying again. have been for a couple weeks but my calorie intake is less than half of what my doctors reccomended when i was last discharged. i just cant increase it. i cant see my future anymore. i cant see anything i once planned. there is no way out of this.

support needed recovery day 1. i have suffered from disordered eating pretty much my whole life including some intense daily bulimia in my early 2 s and now very restricted eating for a long time. i m 35 the past few months things really went downhill and resulted in me being very severely underweight for my height and the lowest i ve ever been by far. i was an avid runner definitely over exercising but then got injured so my activity level is currently zero. i barely have the energy to go up the stairs. today i read tabitha farrar s book and watched a couple videos. i decided enough was enough and this afternoon i got the courage to just let myself eat. cereal, granola, granola bars, protein shake, popcorn, 1 2 jar peanut butter, etc. etc . of course, i m freaking out about it now. but i truly do want to recover and enjoy my life. i am terrified about binging and becoming bulimic again. and yes, i am 1 scared of gaining weight. i am so scared of all of it but i know i have to face these fears. i even had my husband take the scale away. how do i look at this as not a massive binge and as just letting my body heal. is it okay that i still want to eat more today even though my stomach is stuffed. i don t want to make myself sick. i don t know how i m going to function if i m eating like this i m also a teacher . can anyone who has made it past this point share how they kept recovery going? is it possible to recover after nearly a lifetime of disordered eating? thank you so much.

recovery help?. hi everyone so i m in recovery from anorexia but honestly i don t really feel like i m in recovery yet as there hasn t been an increase in my intake yet due to the risk of refeeding syndrome so i m still eating just safe foods, eating a below a healthy amount, weighing myself regularly i guess i m in like quasi recovery? because i m keeping my intake at a stable amount until i am allowed to increase, but haven t been able to actually face any fear foods yet etc. but even though i ve barely made any steps forward, i keep thinking about relapsing. i just don t know how to get out of this mindset : any advice? how do i go all in ?

you will never feel sick enough.. no matter what weight you reach. no matter what bmi you reach. wether you were hospitalised or not. wether you ever had an ng tube or not. no matter what amount of calories you eat or how much exercise. no matter if you have a diagnosis or not. whatever amount of side effects you may or may not have from your ed. i can almost promise you that there is no such thing as "sick enough". however your ed has impacted your life, regardless of your symptoms, situation ect. ect. ect. you are valid you are sick enough you deserve recovery

tips from a recovered person.. hey all. i'm an ednos survivor and currently weight restored and mostly recovered. i still have my bad body image days, but i'd like to share how i made it this far and hopefully help someone. 1: stop weighing yourself. this seems obvious, but i mean never. not even at the doctor's office. i recently achieved my new years resolution of not weighing myself for the entire year of 2 21. if you are at the doctor, stand with your back to the scale and tell them you don't want to know your weight. tell them you don't want your paperwork when you leave. they will print your weight on it. or decline the scale altogether and give them the most recent weight you know. no nurse has ever questioned me and they've all been more than accommodating. 2: set functional goals. think of the things you never get to do because of your eating disorder. do them. mine was weight training. i always wanted to be strong, but i was constantly tired and malnourished. if i was tempted to get on the scale or restrict my intake, i reminded myself that i would never get muscles if i starved. your goal might be something different, like being able to hike without getting winded, or going out to eat more often. 3: donate your clothes. this one also seems obvious. but it's really easy to slip back into your old jeans and lament about what you used to look like. get rid of your clothes when they don't fit anymore, and you don't have to worry about the temptation to self destruct. 4: imagine the person you love most in this world. mom, wife, husband, sister, best friend. now think of all the things you love about them. not one thing on that list is their weight. 5: now imagine that someone calls your loved one an ugly, worthless burden on society. you'd punch them in the face do that to the voice in your head that's low key a huge bitch. punch it in the face. shut that shit down. 6: think of what your eating disorder has taken from you. precious headspace for hobbies. time with loved ones. freedom. sanity. take it back. 7: choose life. you have to want to get better. you have to choose to get better. every. single. day. even when it's hard. if i can do it, anyone can. i almost died. i have a permanent heart condition as a result of my last relapse. i literally had to fight for my life to get here. you, the person reading this. you can do it too. i hope this helped you.

question. trigger: calorie numbers . hi guys. please can somebody help me i am in my recovery but today i ate more than what is on my meal plan. i m supposed to be increasing my calorie intake slowly which i have been doing but i accidentally ate too much. i m trying to regain my metabolism etc but now i m worried if i go down again tomorrow my body will think i m restricting it again. should i just go back down slightly again or try to keep the calories the same as today i feel super weird. i had a 5 cal extra snack basically.

to those in recovery: how much will getting help really change my life?. hi, everyone. i ve been struggling with i believe to be undiagnosed anorexia for about 6 years. i m ready to get help because i think it s impacting every part of my life. i dropped out of college this semester, partially because of the stress of attempting to manage whatever disordered eating habits i have. since the new year, i ve been trying to eat normally and improve my relationship with food, but i fear it s sunk so far into my life i won t be able to escape it. my depression and anxiety have been getting worse and i want help, i really do. i am just terrified of talking to my parents who both have disordered eating habits and are currently dealing with my brother s binging. i think i feel resentful. that he, at 13, is getting the help i feel i ve needed for a long time. and part of me is so pissed at my parents for never believing me when i mentioned my issues to them numerous times. but what i really wanted to ask is how much did recovery impact every part of your life, not just food? i think it s time, i m just so scared.

long time lurker first time poster. random thought, but does anyone else experience this?. i would say i m partially recovered, i still struggle heavily daily and still relapse for a few days but it s been about a year and a half since i ve been completely problematic. when i get hungry it s extremely violent. the problem is that when i do get hungry it s about a 2 minute time span that i have to eat.. in those 2 mins food is an obsession i can smell it, my mouth is watering and all i can think about is food. doesn t even have to be a specific food but i m craving it so badly and if i can get my hands on it i ll eat it. i get a pain before i eat of emptiness and it is physical but more empty feeling than pain but usually stops right after i finish eating. but, if i miss that 2 minutes though, i completely and usually honestly forget about eating, like don t even acknowledge it exists and i couldn t fathom even being hungry. the weirdest part though is how much excruciating pain physical pain i get when i do force myself to eat after those 2 mins. i m not sure why my body is so extreme with this maybe because my past of not eating but is this something that i feel is so out of my control so i don t know how to combat it but it s extremely debilitating because i m either happy and thankful i m eating or i m in so much pain i feel like i m gonna vomit so it s hard in the first place to even eat at that point. also does food better when you accept it because i also seem to convince myself that after those 2 mins pass and i m in pain that everything is suddenly going to make me sick or that it s gross? sorry for so much text. i never posted before because i never have a straight line of thought lol.

looking for participants for an ed related study . hi all i'm a university student within the uk studying psychology and criminology. i've been suffering with an eating disorder for about 5 years now and since entering recovery have been more interested to see how other people feel diagnosed or not; believed to have and ed or not surrounding their attitudes towards eating. the questions in my survey also ask about body dissatisfaction and social media usage in relation to your gender identity enbys included . if you're 18 and interested in participating, and are not triggered by answering in relation to eds, please feel free to click the link below the survey should only take about 5 minutes but your participation truly means a lot to me thanks so much everyone, do let me know if you have any questions or if you've completed said survey : amp; x2 b; https: ntupsychology.eu.qualtrics.com jfe form sv 7qu5tkic32ovrsw
